content.description:
Rope Eater is a fun crack climb with a bouldery start off some cheatstones to get established in the bomb bay wide section.  Sleaze right to the lip of the roof, then boulder out the roof section on good holds and jams, before finishing on the .6/.7 handcrack section. 

  This climb is indeed a rope eater, and if you hang on either boulder problem the rope will get sucked into the crack.  this happened to us, and we were able to retrieve it by having the second hang on a couple cams, untie, and pull the rope through from above.
content.protection: fingers to hand sized cams, I placed a thin nut as well.  largish cams for the anchors.
content.location: about 80 feet left of Bush Crack.  on the approach, it looks like an easy corner crack, when you get close in behind the boulders you see the roof start.  cheatstones at the base.

content.description: This climb is the back side of Bush Crack. Work your way into the chimney following an edge that runs out just before reaching the crack. Follow the hand crack up the narrow chimney. Scramble off to the Southeast or walk off to the North.
content.protection: This climb has traditionally been considered a boulder problem. However, it could easily be top roped if desired. Take medium sized cams for an anchor. It would probably be an awkward lead.
content.location: Located in the chimney behind Bush Crack. Scramble up and right from Bush Crack to find the entrance to the chimney.

content.description: A 12' right leaning crack problem located on the same wall, but to the left of En Passant. Also worth doing on the way to Buzzards roped climbs.
content.location: Located on a short wall on the West Southwestern flank of Buzzards. Part way up the dome. Much lower and further West than The Cubes. Pretty much across from Mirage Wall. Can be seen from the loop trail.

content.description: 15 ft vertical hand crack boulder problem on the West Southwestern flank of Buzzards. Very high rock quality. Worth doing on the way to Buzzards main attractions.
content.location: Located on a short wall on the West Southwestern flank of Buzzards. Part way up the dome. Much lower and further West than The Cubes. Pretty much across from Mirage Wall. Can be seen from the Loop Trail.

content.description: This is the wide crack just to the left of Bush Crack.  It starts off about fist sized and turns into a squeeze chimney towards the top.  Great practice for squeeze chimney technique.
content.protection: medium at the bottom to large at the top.  You can prob use a 5 or 6 camalot towards the mid point. There is also a horizontal crack you can place some smaller gear in before moving into the squeeze chimney...Then just run it to the top.  Good heel to toe jams down low.

content.description: Cubes is a short hand crack that pulls over to a short loose finish.
content.protection: Standard rack relying mostly on hand size cams. No anchors up top; bring long slings for building anchor above.
content.location: Look for the obvious dihedral on the right of the Cube Boulder, the largest rock to the top left of the southwest side of Buzzard's Roost.

content.description: A nice two section climb beginning with a flake to a good stance followed by a sweet finger crack to the top.
content.protection: Bush Crack requires a standard rack with hand sizes up top to build the anchor.
content.location: Look to the right of the southwest area for a wall sitting behind various large boulders.  Bush Crack leaves a small space marked by a tree.

content.description: This is the southwest area of Buzzard's Roost looking over the Loop Trail. The area is marked by various large blocks to the left and a wall hidden by trees and rocks to the right.
